page.title: 10Religios customs--Denny area
page.content: Customs common to local Christians:- {Easter Sunday-}many children roll hard boiled, painted eggs down the hill in Herbertshire park. This reminds us of the large stone rolling away from Jesus' tomb. {THE CHRISTENING PIECE-}a small gift of cake and a silver coin given to the first person met by the Godparents on their way to church for a baptism.{ {THE SCRAMBLE}or{SCATTER-}here coins are thrown by the bridegroom or best man as they leave the church after the wedding {THE WAKE-}This is popular among local catholics. The dead person's friends meet to say the rosary around the coffin. {KIRK O' MUIR-}Local Protestants meet on the first Sunday of August on MUIRS-HILLS- above Denny for open-air service to remember the{COVENANTERS.}
